title: How to actively promote my blog content without looking like spam - Quora

response.answer_text: Build a strong, loyal, and engaged community around your blog! You don’t need a lot of money, you just need to be active and build relations without being spammy.  Basing on my experience as the online marketing manager I have compiled a list of good practices which let you grow traffic on your website. I shared it already in a few answers, but it’s constantly growing.  Here’re my best tips to increase traffic by building and engaging community (only easy to provide, and affordable things you can do to stand out from the crowd) Post regularly - it is a must! People like to know that they can regularly read something new on your website. Keep it alive!Write an e-book, do a webinar, organize an online course, a live session - it’s always good to give something to your audience. They will repay with love, shares, and engagement. Also, it let you create your own personal brand as an expert, and this is priceless!Build a database of e-mail addresses - this way you would be able to stay in touch with your audience. It’s a good idea to give them something for subscribing, for example, an e-book :)Use social media - find places where your target audience is active, set up a fanpage, g+ profile. Instagram, Snapchat or Twitter account. But choose wisely and be there where your audience already is to meet them instead of wasting time and trying to get them there.Share your posts on social media. Use your fanpage and personal profile. Share posts on groups for bloggers or thematic groups (check terms of the group to ensure that you’re allowed to post links to your own blog).Implement social buttons on your website and articles - it makes sharing so much easier, and people just like to use them. Use one of the available plugins; it’s quite easy.Don’t forget about CTA! - Like post! Subscribe! Follow! Leave a comment! Sign-up for a newsletter! (Upvote this answer if you find it helpful! :) ) At the end of your blog posts and social media, posts put some call to action and encourage people to share your posts.Say thank you!- react to every single share of your content on the internet. Like, comment, say thank you, engage in conversations. It’s so easy and let your readers know that you are grateful, care about them and their opinions.Engage - engage in online conversations relevant to your blog posts on the internet. Share your knowledge, make people like you, and share links to your articles. Share their posts and content related to your topic, it’ll pay you back!Cooperate - with other authors, bloggers and experts. Find influencers in your niche, talk to them, engage them, collaborate. This way you can reach their audience and let them reach yours. Win-win! #protip The best way to track mentions on the internet is to use some tool which will constantly monitor the web for you instead of searching manually through the internet and all social media channels. Here the great help for you would be an application for real-time internet monitoring and analyses called BRAND24. It gives you instant access to all public mentions on the internet and allows you to track and engage in online conversations relevant to the topic you’re interested in. The tool shows you in one dashboard mentions from all over the web, from social media to influential publishers. Thanks to this you can track shares of your blog posts, mentions about you and your blog, join and engage in conversations. Also, due to analyses, you can find inside the dashboard you could find influencers and authors with the biggest social media reach, so you will know who to cooperate with. Start monitoring now, try a free trial and see how beneficial it’d be for you!  I hope I helped!Thanks for the answer request!

Ovoid submitting your blog URLs without explaining first what to expect,otherwise it will look like you are just looking for link clicks and you don't worry about helping others,Do guest blogging and limit the number of URLs in the article: for me if an article is full of links,it looks spammy thus you should ovoid multiple URLs per article,Use Quora and answer as many questions (related to your blog articles and put links back to them in your answers) you like but OVOID REPEATING THE SAME ANSWERS. You will look natural and very helpful,Use Reddit as well but again ovoid submitting URLs with zero added value . You are always looking to be helpful and seem natural at the same time.…. There is still a lot of other things you can do to promote your content and still look professional instead of looking spammy. . Good luck with your online business!

I'm a huge advocate of growing your email list which can help you promote your blog to people that actually care. You can grow your email list by offered a lead magnet or content upgrade that's relevant to your audience. I've had the best luck with promoting my blog post on social media. I take the time to write catchy headlines that grabs people's attention.

Thanks for the A2A, Cagatay Paftali. The answer lies in your question. The key to quality traffic lies in getting information around relevant people, rather than spamming everybody. Join social media groups related to your niche. There are plenty of groups in Facebook and Reddit on virtually every niche. Answer questions related to your niche in Quora. Make an impression that you have a good amount of knowledge on the thing you’re writing. If people who are in need of help know that you are a pro in your field, they’ll consume all your content. That’s how you get quality traffic. I hope this helps.

Spam relevant people. Specifically, link to relevant blog posts in forum conversations, like on LinkedIn and Reddit, or in your answers to questions here. Just make sure the link actually addresses the topic, and don't do it every single time you answer a question.
